title: Synthetic Recap
body:
LOS ANGELES — The Los Angeles Clippers saw him coming, but they were powerless to stop him. In a masterclass of individual dominance, Shawn Kemp delivered a performance for the ages, pouring in a career-high and franchise-record 47 points to single-handedly dismantle the Clippers in a 94-78 road victory for the Seattle SuperSonics.

From the opening tip, this was the Shawn Kemp show. The “Reign Man” was uncontainable, operating with a devastating blend of brute force and breathtaking athleticism. He attacked the rim with ferocious dunks, hit from mid-range, and even stretched the defense, finishing an efficient 19-of-29 from the field. His 47 points were not just a number; they were a statement, accounting for exactly half of his team’s entire offensive output on the night.

While Gary Payton contributed a solid 16 points and 11 assists, this night belonged solely to Kemp. The Clippers, led by Loy Vaught’s 18 points and 13 rebounds, had no answer. Every defensive scheme they threw at him was rendered useless. He was a force of nature, and the game’s narrative was rewritten with every basket he scored.

In the annals of Sonics history, this will stand as one of the most spectacular individual efforts ever recorded. It was more than a win; it was a historic coronation on an opponent’s floor, a night when one transcendent talent was simply too much for any five men to handle. Shawn Kemp didn’t just beat the Clippers; he overwhelmed them, leaving his name permanently etched in the record books.
